result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary Beth Sparling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Court found that the defendant is currently indigent and waived all of the nonmandatory costs and surcharges. Defendant is to pay the DV surcharge plus the DNA surcharge. Bail to apply, if any.  Remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
*Restitution set at zero.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mary Beth Sparling in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 3 months in the House of Correction, consecutive,  with credit for -0- days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 14 months, concurrent,  with the following conditions:
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with firearms.
- Court found that the defendant is currently indigent and waived all of the non-mandatory costs and surcharges.  The defendant is to pay the DV surcharge plus the DNA surcharge, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defendant Mary Beth Sparling in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
As to count 1:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
As to count 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mary Beth Sparling in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel informs the court that he received discovery today.  Defense is requesting a projected guilty plea date in Branch 36.
  Plea hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mary Beth Sparling in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
NO FILE IN COURT.
The defendant appeared in court today.  She thought she was supposed to report back on today's date.
The court withdrew the warrant and reinstated her bail.
Case calendared for a status date in Branch 36.
  Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Mary Beth Sparling not in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled at approximately 3:00 p.m.
Defendant has three cases before the court.

Court notes that Atty. Liggins was allowed to withdraw.  Deputy clerk contacted the Public Defenders office and was advised that defendant did report and was interviewed, she was instructed to return to Branch 36.
  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court. 
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Mary Beth Sparling in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel is leaving the Public Defender's Office.  The defendant wants to be interviewed by that office to see if she still qualifies.
The court instructed the defendant to go the office right now and return with the letter that says she qualifies.
.
Case passed...
.

Defendant Mary Beth Sparling in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
This case was scheduled for a plea and sentencing today.
Defendant now wants to hire her own counsel.
The court will allow an adjournment of 2 weeks for her to obtain counsel.
Case adjourned for a status of counsel in Branch 36.
Attorney Liggins is to appear on the next court date and turn over discovery to the new attorney.
  Status conference scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mary Beth Sparling in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The Court was advised that the defendant is wishing to resolve all 3 cases.  Case is calendared for a plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 36.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mary Beth Sparling in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing.  All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing to branch 23.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mary Beth Sparling in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Pretrial Conference. Defense counsel requests case be adjourned for Pretrial Conference. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with David D

Defendant Mary Beth Sparling in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Mary Beth Sparling in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
